actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Children, Family, Drugs, Alcohol.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Children, Family, Drugs and Alcoholism

official_title: A bill to amend the Domestic Volunteer Service Act of 1973 to provide for programs of national and local significance, and for other purposes.
subjects: Day care centers for the aged

summary.text: Amends the Domestic Volunteer Service Act of 1973 to require the Director of the ACTION Agency to establish, within each volunteer program under such Act, a program for making grants to support programs that address urgent national problems in a creative way on a local level. Gives priority for such grants to the following volunteer programs of national significance: (1) assistance to individuals with chronic and debilitating illnesses such as acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS); (2) reduction of drug and alcohol abuse; (3) assistance to teenage parents; (4) senior volunteers mentoring youths in need of guidance; (5) adult and school-based literacy programs; (6) respite care, including home care for the elderly or for disabled or chronically ill children; (7) before- and after-school programs, at libraries and other organizations, serving children of working parents; (8) caring for boarder babies; (9) services to children with special needs in child care; (10) care of developmentally disabled adults at home or in community-based settings, including involvement of such individuals in volunteer work; and (11) tutoring of educationally disadvantaged children.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Domestic Volunteer Service Act of 1973 to provide for programs of national and local significance, and for other purposes.
